revisions.rev:
{{double image|right|Flag of Palestine.svg|229|Palestinian National Authority COA.svg|84|The [[Palestinian Flag]]|The [[Coat of arms of the Palestinian National Authority]]}} [[Image:LocationPalestine.svg|thumb|A map of the [[Palestinian territories]] with the [[West Bank]] and [[Gaza Strip]] highlighted in red]] [[Image:West Bank & Gaza Map 2007 (Settlements).png|thumb|An enlargeable map of the [[Palestinian territories]] and central [[Israel]]]] [[Image:Westbankjan06.jpg|thumb|An enlargeable map of the [[West Bank]]]] [[Image:Gaza Strip 2009 Jan 13.png|thumb|An enlargeable map of the [[Gaza Strip]]]]
The '''[[Palestinian territories]]''' or Occupied Palestinian Territory are two conventional name used, among others, to describe the territories of the [[West Bank]], [[East Jerusalem]] and the [[Gaza Strip]], which were designated as the jurisdiction of the [[Palestinian Authority]] in the Palestinian-Israeli agreement of 13 September 1993.<ref>Paragraph IV of the 1993 Declaration of Principles, which is part of the [[Oslo Accords]], [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/in_depth/middle_east/israel_and_the_palestinians/key_documents/1682727.stm full text on the BBC News website].</ref> Occasionally these territories are also referred to as Palestine, which creates some ambiguity with the term [[Palestine]] as a geographic region between the [[Mediterranean Sea]] and the [[Jordan River]], and various adjoining lands.<ref name=PEF>{{cite web|title=The Palestine Exploration Fund|publisher=The [[Palestine Exploration Fund]]|url=http://www.pef.org.uk/oldsite/Paldef.htm|accessdate=2008-04-04}}</ref>
The final status of the Palestinian territories and their final boundaries are two issues that have been subject to deep dispute within the context of the [[Israeli-Palestinian conflict]]. The names and terminology used to describe the territory or locations within its current boundaries are also often disputed. In the [[Palestinian National Charter]], the Palestinian [[homeland]] is defined as the territory of British Mandate Palestine (excluding [[Transjordan]]).<ref name=Said>Said and Hitchens, 2001, p. 199.</ref> The [[State of Israel]] was established as a national homeland for the [[Jews]] in approximately three-quarters of this territory in May 1948, amid the [[1948 Arab-Israeli war]]. The remaining quarter, comprising the [[Gaza Strip]] and the [[West Bank]] (including what is now known as [[East Jerusalem]]), were [[Occupation of the Gaza Strip by Egypt|occupied by Egypt]] and [[Occupation of the West Bank and East Jerusalem by Jordan|by Jordan]], and later [[Israeli-occupied territories|by Israel]] during the 1967 [[Six Day War]].
The Palestinian people, including the [[Palestinian diaspora]], have been represented before the international community by the [[Palestine Liberation Organization]] (PLO) since its establishment in 1964. In November 1988, the [[Palestinian National Council]] (PNC), the [[government-in-exile|parliament-in-exile]] of the PLO [[Palestinian Declaration of Independence|proclaimed the establishment]] of the State of Palestine, diplomatically recognized by several tens of countries.<ref>There are contradicting reports about the actual number ranging from 67 [http://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5g8_mQhPKa5f5urfm_o3_nYf_Y_Wg] to about 100</ref> Deviating from the usual criteria governing the classic definition of a [[nation-state|state]] or [[country]], the precise boundaries of Palestine have yet to be determined and full autonomy has yet to be secured.<ref name=George>{{cite web|title=Is Palestine a State?|author=Forji Amin George|date=June 2004|url=http://www.expertlaw.com/library/international_law/palestine.html|accessdate=2008-04-04|publisher=Expert Law}}</ref><ref name=Miltonp5>Milton-Edwards, 2008, p. 5.</ref> The [[Palestinian National Authority]], established pursuant to the [[Oslo Accords]], is an interim administrative body responsible for governance in population Palestinian centers in the [[West Bank]] and [[Gaza Strip]] until final status negotiations are concluded.<ref name=EF/>
The following outline is provided as an overview of and topical guide to the Palestinian territories:
{{TOC limit|limit=2}}

== Geography of the Palestinian territories == [[Image:Israel Topography.png|thumb|An enlargeable topographic map of [[Israel]] and the [[Palestinian territories]]. Outlined in red are the 1949-designated boundaries of the [[West Bank]] and [[Gaza Strip]]]] {{main|Palestinian territories|Geography of the Palestinian territories}}
* The Palestinian territories are: Israeli-occupied/Semi-autonomous region, with status to be determined by further negotiations * Location: ** [[Northern Hemisphere]] and [[Eastern Hemisphere]] ** [[Eurasia]] *** [[Asia]] **** [[Southwest Asia]] ***** [[Middle East]] ** [[Time zone]]: [[UTC+02]], summer [[UTC+03]] ** Extreme points of the Palestinian territories *** High: [[Tall Asur]] {{convert|1022|m|ft|0|abbr=on}} *** Low: [[Dead Sea]] {{convert|-412|m|ft|0|abbr=on}} â lowest point on the surface of the [[Earth]] ** Land boundaries: Officially undefined, figures given are the de facto boundaries of the [[Green Line (Israel)|Green Line]] as they apply to the [[West Bank]] and [[Gaza Strip]] (See also [[Israeli West Bank barrier]], [[Israeli Gaza Strip barrier]] and the [[Seam Zone]]) :* Total: {{convert|466|km|mi|abbr=on}} ::{{Flag|Israel}} {{convert|358|km|mi|abbr=on}} ::{{Flag|Jordan}} {{convert|97|km|mi|abbr=on}} ::{{Flag|Egypt}} {{convert|11|km|mi|abbr=on}} :* Coastline: [[Mediterranean Sea]] {{convert|40|km|mi|abbr=on}} * [[Palestinian people|Population of the Palestinian territories]]: ** [[Palestinian people#Demographics|Palestinian population worldwide, including diaspora]]: est. 10,000,000 - 11,000,000 ** [[Demographics of the Palestinian territories|Population of the Palestinian territories]]: est. 3,800,000 * Area of the Palestinian territories: ** [[Palestinian territories]] (post-1967): {{convert|6220|km2|sqmi|abbr=on}}; The [[Geography of the West Bank|West Bank]] (including [[East Jerusalem]]) is ({{convert|5860|km2|sqmi|abbr=on}} and the [[Geography of the Gaza Strip|Gaza Strip]] is {{convert|360|km2|sqmi|abbr=on}} * [[:commons:Atlas of Palestine|Atlas of Palestine]]

== Government and politics of the Palestinian territories == : ''Main article: [[Government of the Palestinian territories]] and [[Politics of the Palestinian territories]]'' [[File:Palaestinensischer Legislativrat.jpg|thumb|right|220px|The building of the [[Palestinian Legislative Council]] in [[Ramallah]]]] * [[Form of government]]: [[Semi-presidential system|semi-presidential]] [[parliamentary democracy]]<ref name=EF>{{cite web|title=Palestinian Territories|url=http://www.europeanforum.net/country/palestinian_territories|author=Martijn Schoonvelde|date=26 June 2009|accessdate=2009-07-26}}</ref> [[File:OldCityJerusalem01 ST 06.JPG|220px|thumb|The [[souq]] in the [[Old City (Jerusalem)|Old City of Jerusalem, which both the Palestinians and Israelis proclaim as their capital]]]] * [[Capital (political)|Capital]] of Palestine: ** Proclaimed capital: [[East Jerusalem]] (also proclaimed by Israel) ** [[de facto]] capital: [[Ramallah]] * [[Elections in the Palestinian territories]] ** [[Elections of the Palestinian National Authority]] *** [[Palestinian general election, 1996]] *** [[Palestinian presidential election, 2005]] *** [[Palestinian municipal elections, 2005]] *** [[Palestinian legislative election, 2006]] *** [[Next Palestinian general election]] ** [[PNA governments]] *** [[Palestinian government of October 2002|PNA government of October 2002]] *** [[Palestinian government of November 2003|PNA government of November 2003]] *** [[Palestinian government of March 2006]] *** [[Palestinian government of March 2007|PNA government of March 2007]] *** [[Palestinian government of June 2007|PNA government of June 2007]] * [[List of political parties of Palestine|Political parties of the Palestinian territories]] ** [[List of political parties in the Palestinian National Authority|Political parties of the PNA]] ** [[PLO#Membership|Political parties of the PLO]] * [[Political scandals of the Palestinian territories]] * [[Taxation in the Palestinian territories]]
=== Branches of the government of the Palestinian territories === ==== Executive branch of the PLO ==== [[Image:Arafat, Nasser and Abu Jihad at Arab conference.jpg|thumb|right|[[Yasser Arafat]] and [[Abu Jihad]] meet [[Gamal Abdel Nasser]] upon arrival in [[Cairo]] to attend first emergency [[Arab League]] summit, 1970]] * [[Palestine Liberation Organization]] ** [[Chairman of the Palestine Liberation Organization]] and [[President of the State of Palestine|President of Palestine]]: [[Mahmoud Abbas]] ** [[Executive Committee of the Palestine Liberation Organization]]
==== Executive branch of the PNA ==== *[[Palestinian Authority]] **[[President]]: [[Mahmoud Abbas]] **[[President]]: [[Aziz Duwaik]] **[[Prime Minister]]: [[Salam Fayyad]] **[[Prime Minister]]: [[Ismail Haniyeh]] *NB. As a result of the [[Fatah-Hamas conflict]], there is a dispute over the Presidency and Prime Ministership of the Palestinian Authority. **Ministries of the PNA ***[[Education Minister of the Palestinian National Authority|Education Ministry]] ***[[Foreign Affairs Minister of the Palestinian National Authority|Foreign Affairs Ministry]] ***[[Finance Minister of the Palestinian National Authority|Finance Ministry]] ***[[Health Minister of the Palestinian National Authority|Health Ministry]] ***[[Interior Minister of the Palestinian National Authority|Interior Ministry]] ***[[Planning Minister of the Palestinian National Authority|Planning Ministry]]
==== Legislative branches of the government of the Palestinian territories ==== *[[Palestinian Legislative Council]] ([[Palestinian National Authority|PNA]], [[unicameral]]) *[[Palestinian National Council]] ([[Palestinian Liberation Organisation|PLO]], [[unicameral]], [[Government-in-exile|parliament-in-exile]]<ref name=Selap16>Sela and Ma'oz, 1997, p. 16.</ref>)
==== Judicial branch of the government of the Palestinian territories ==== *According to the Constitution of Palestine, all courts relating to the country shall be independent.

=== Palestine and the United Nations === [[Image:UN Partition Plan For Palestine 1947.png|thumb|right|180px|UN 1947 partition plan for Palestine]] * [[United Nations Partition Plan for Palestine]] * [[United Nations Palestine Commission]] * [[United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East]] (UNRWA) * [[List of the UN resolutions concerning Israel and Palestine|United Nations resolutions concerning Palestine]] * [[United Nations Special Committee on Palestine]] (UNSCOP) * [[United Nations Division for Palestinian Rights]] (UNDPR) ** [[Committee on the Exercise of the Inalienable Rights of the Palestinian People]] *** [[International Day of Solidarity with the Palestinian People]] * [[Israel, Palestine, and the United Nations]]
=== International organization membership === [[Image:Un1981-343.jpg|thumb|UN stamp commemorating the inalienable rights of the [[Palestinian people]]]] Palestine is a member in a number of international organizations. In others, it enjoys affiliation in a lesser capacity or under another designation (such as [[PLO]] or [[Occupied Palestinian Territory]]). In the list below, if the membership is not full or not for the state of Palestine, the type and name of affiliation is denoted in parentheses.
* [[Arab Fund for Economic and Social Development]] (AFESD) * [[Arab League]] (AL) * [[Arab Monetary Fund]] (AMF) * [[Council of Arab Economic Unity]] (CAEU) * [[FIFA]] ([[Asian Football Confederation]] (AFC) * [[Group of 77]] (G77) * [[International Olympic Committee]] (IOC) * [[International Trade Union Confederation]] (ITUC) (''[[PGFTU - Palestinian General Federation of Trade Unions|affiliate member]]'') * [[International Telecommunication Union]] (ITU) (''non-voting observer status'') * [[International Organization for Standardization]] (ISO) (''[[Countries in International Organization for Standardization|representation for 'Occupied Palestinian Territory' equivalent to that of a state]]'') * [[International Paralympic Committee]] (IPC) * [[International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies]] (IFRC) * [[International Committee of the Red Cross]] (ICRC) * [[Islamic Development Bank]] (IDC) * [[Organisation of Islamic Cooperation]] (OIC) * [[Non-Aligned Movement]] (NAM) * [[United Nations]] (UN) (''[[United Nations General Assembly observers|permanent observer]] with [[State of Palestine#United Nations representation|special privileges]]'') (current representative:[[Riyad H. Mansour]]) ** [[United Nations Regional Groups|Asian Group of the United Nations]] ** [[United Nations Economic and Social Commission for Western Asia]] (UNESCWA) * [[UNESCO]] * [[Universal Postal Union]] (UPU) (''special observer status'') * [[World Health Organization]] (WHO) (''observer status for the [[PLO]]'') (see also: [[State of Palestine#Application to the WHO|Palestine's application to the WHO]]) * [[World Intellectual Property Organization]] (WIPO)
